Detailed Description

A managed object which stores the configuration settings of a BmxBk.

One, and only one of these, is inserted into a new BmxBk when it is initially created.

Member Function Documentation

- (NSArray *) externalizersOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's externalizers objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (NSArray *) internalizersOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's internalizersOrdered objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (NSArray *) jobsOrdered  

Returns an array of the receiver's jobs objects, sorted ascending by their 'index'.

Returns:
The sorted array.

- (Ixternalizer *) newExternalizerAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Ixternalizer, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's externalizers, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Ixternalizer in the receiver's externalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Ixtnernalizer.
Returns:
The new Ixternalizer

- (Ixternalizer *) newInternalizerAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Ixternalizer, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's internalizers, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Ixternalizer in the receiver's internalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Ixtnernalizer.
Returns:
The new Ixternalizer

- (Job *) newJobAtIndex: (int)  index  

Returns a new Job, inserted at a given index, or at as low an index as possible, in the receiver's jobs, in the receiver's managed object context.

If inserting the new Job in the receiver's externalizers would create a gap in the sequence of their indexes, the index is reduced to a value which would close the gap.

Parameters:
index The desired index of the new Job.
Returns:
The new Job

Property Documentation

- (NSNumber*) browserVisit [read, write, retain]

A number indicating which browser will be used when the user visits an item in the owning BmxBk.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmmBrowserVisit values.

- (NSNumber*) defaultSortable [read, write, retain]

A number indicating whether items not explicitly marked as sortable are sortable.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmmDefaultSortable values.

- (NSSet*) externalizers [read, write, retain]

An set of the Ixternalizations which should be executed when the receiver performs a Sync Out.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members.

- (NSNumber*) filterIgnoredPrefixes [read, write, retain]

A number indicating whether or not ignored prefixes should be filtered when sorting the items in the receiver.

The value of the number should be a BOOL, YES or NO.

- (NSNumber*) ignoreDisparateDupes [read, write, retain]

A number indicating whether or duplicate pairs in different collections should be detected when finding duplicates in the receiver.

The value of the number should be a BOOL, YES or NO.

- (NSSet*) internalizers [read, write, retain]

An set of the Ixternalizations which should be executed when the receiver performs a Sync In.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members.

- (NSNumber*) isRootSortable [read, write, retain]

A number indicating whether or not the root item of the receiver is sortable.

The value of the number should be a BOOL, YES or NO.

- (NSSet*) jobs [read, write, retain]

An ordered set of the automated Jobs currently assigned in the receiver.

The set may be ordered by the -index attributes of its members. Ordering is only necessary in this case to give the user a consistent table display.

- (NSNumber*) sortBy [read, write, retain]

A number indicating which attribute to sort items by in the owning BmxBk.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmmSortBy values.

- (NSNumber*) sortFoldersAt [read, write, retain]

A number indicating where folders should be sorted with respect to bookmarks in the receiver.

The value of the number should be an integer, one of the BkmmSortFoldersAt values.
